intro: Schoenolirion texanum, commonly known as the Texas lily, is a perennial plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a basal rosette. Schoenolirion texanum is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
